info.title: MSSP
info.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to view and manage your MSSP customer accounts. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Account endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to view and manage your MSSP customer accounts. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Child Containers
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Child Containers endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to view and manage your child accounts. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Dashboards
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Dashboard endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to retrieve details for various dashboard widgets. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Domains
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Domains endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to add domains, list domains, get domain details, update domains, and send activation codes to add domains. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Filters
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Filters endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to list the filtering capabilities for the other MSSP endpoints that support filtering. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: License
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. License endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to retrieve license details for the account associated with the user's API credentials. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

tags.name: Logos
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage the logos of their customer's Tenable.io instances. By default, the Tenable.io logo appears in the header of your customer's instances. The logo endpoints allow you to replace the Tenable.io logo with a logo appropriate to a customer's business context. Use these endpoints to add, assign, and delete logos. 

For background information about logos in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see [Logos](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Logos.htm) in Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide.

tags.name: Resource Links
tags.description:
The Tenable.io Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) Portal API provides a secure and accessible way for MSSP administrators to manage and maintain multiple customer instances of Tenable products. Resource Links endpoints in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal API allow you to add resource links, bulk add resource links, update resource links, and list resource links. 

For background information about the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, see the [Tenable.io MSSP Portal User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/managed-security-service-provider/Content/Welcome.htm).

post.description:
Creates an evaluation account.
Requires ADMINISTRATOR [64] user permissions. See [Permissions](doc:permissions).

email.description: The primary contact's email address. A valid email address must be in the format `name@domain`.

country.description: The primary contact's country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. Valid country codes are `AU`, `BR`, `CA`, `EU`, `IN`, `JP`, `SG`, `UK`, and `US`.

200.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Platform successfully created the evaluation account.

uuid.description: The UUID of the new evaluation account.

400.description: Returned if your request specified invalid parameters or if your request was improperly formatted.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

500.description: Returned if an internal error occurred in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

value.message: An internal server error occurred. Please wait a moment and try your request again.

get.description:
Returns a list of child accounts in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal. A child account contains information about a customer instance of a Tenable.io product, including product license information and user-defined notes that can include valuable internal tracking or customer contact information.
Requires BASIC [16] user permissions. See [Permissions](doc:permissions).

parameters.description:
A filter condition in the format `field:operator:value`. For example, `f=container_name:match:tenable`. 

**Note:** To retrieve a list of filters to use with this endpoint, see the  [GET /filters/mssp/accounts](ref:io-mssp-filters-account-list) endpoint. 

See the list below for additional examples of possible filter combinations:  
* uuid:neq:afe4fa83-8430-4f7b-a4dd-c25bcfd21317  
* licensed_assets:gte:222  
* license_utilization:lt:100  
* license_expiration_date:gt:90  
* licensed_apps:eq:was,lumin  
* region:eq:US
parameters.name: f

parameters.description: If multiple `f` parameters are present, specifies whether Tenable.io MSSP applies `AND` or `OR` to conditions. Supported values are `and` and `or`. If you omit this parameter when using multiple `f` parameters, Tenable.io applies `AND` by default.
parameters.name: ft

parameters.description: Wildcard filter text. Wildcard search is a mechanism where multiple fields of a record are filtered against one specific filter string. If any one of the wildcard\_fields' values matches against the filter string, then the record matches the wildcard filter. For a record to be returned, it must pass the wildcard filter (if there is one) AND the set of standard filters. For example, if `w=wild&f=field1:match:one&f=field2:match:two&ft=or`, the record would match if the value of any supported wildcard\_fields contained `wild`, AND either field1's value contained `one` or field2's value contained `two`.
parameters.name: w

parameters.description:
A comma-delimited subset of wildcard\_fields to search when applying the wildcard filter. For example, `field1,field2`. If `w` is provided, but `wf` is not, then all wildcard\_fields' values are searched against the wildcard filter text. 

**Note:** To retrieve a list of fields that can be used as wild cards, see the [GET /filters/mssp/accounts](ref:io-mssp-filters-account-list) endpoint.
parameters.name: wf

200.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Portal successfully retrieved the list of child accounts.

accounts.notes: Some notes about this child account
Some notes about this child account

post.summary: Generate auth keys for child container
post.description:
Generates authorization keys for the specified child container. An `access_key` and a `secret_key` is included in the response.
Requires ADMINISTRATOR [64] user permissions. See [Permissions](doc:permissions).

child_container_uuid.description: The UUID of the child container you want to generate authorization keys for.

keys_validity_duration_seconds.description: The number of seconds that the authorization keys should remain valid. The maximum value is `3600`. If this parameter is omitted, Tenable.io MSSP uses the default value of `1800` seconds.

200.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Platform successfully generated authorization keys for the specified child container.

parent_container_uuid.description: The UUID of the parent container.

child_container_uuid.description: The UUID of the child container associated with the parent customer account.

child_container_site.description: The cloud region in which the child container is located.

keys_user_uuid.description: The UUID of the read-only MSSP child keys user.

access_key.description: The generated access key. It must be paired with the `secret_key`.

secret_key.description: The generated secret key. It must be paired with the `access_key`.

keys_expiration_epoch_seconds.description: The date and time in Unix format when the authorization keys expire.

remote.description: Indicates whether or not the parent and child containers are in the same cloud region. If `true`, the parent and child containers are located in different cloud regions. If `false`, the parent and child containers are located in the same cloud region.

_validity_info.description: The date and time in datetime format when the authorization keys expire.

400.description: Returned if your request specified invalid parameters or if your request was improperly formatted.

404.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Platform could not find the specified child container.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

500.description: Returned if an internal error occurred in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

value.message: An internal server error occurred. Please wait a moment and try your request again.

get.description:
Returns the data for the specified dashboard widget.
Requires BASIC [16] user permissions. See [Permissions](doc:permissions).

parameters.name: widget
parameters.description:
The dashboard widget you want to retrieve data for. You can retrieve data for two dashboard widgets:
  • customer_licensing_data—This widget provides a quick list of customer accounts and their basic licensing snapshot.
  • scan_results—This widget provides a list of customer accounts and some high level scan metadata for each one.

200.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Platform successfully retrieved the request dashboard widget data.

404.description: Returned if the Tenable.io MSSP Platform could not find the specified dashboard widget.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

post.description:
Adds a logo to the Tenable.io MSSP Portal. After you add a logo to the Tenable.io MSSP Portal, use the [PUT /mssp/accounts/logos](ref:io-mssp-logos-assign) endpoint to assign the logo to a customer account.
Requires ADMINISTRATOR [64] user permissions. See [Permissions](doc:permissions).

logo.description: The logo to upload. The logo must be in PNG format and no larger than 246x52 pixels.

name.description: An identifiable, user-defined name for the logo.

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io MSSP Portal successfully added the logo.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid query parameter values.

value.error: request should be multipart and include a single 'name' part

value.message: An internal server error occurred. Please wait a moment and try your request again.

accounts.description: An array of customer account objects.

history.description: An array of child container history objects.

domains_list.description: An array of customer account objects.

accounts.description: An array of customer account objects.

uuid.description: The UUID of the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

container_name.description: The name of the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

licensed_assets.description: The number of assets currently counted against the customer's Tenable.io license.

licensed_assets_limit.description: The number of assets which the customer is licensed to scan.

licensed_apps.description:
List of licensed Tenable applications. The applications can include:
  • pci—Tenable.io PCI/ASV
  • was—Tenable.io Web Application Scanning
  • consec—Tenable.io Container Security
  • lumin—Tenable Lumin

domains.description: A list of the customer domains.

name.description: The name of the resource link.

url.description: The URL of the resource link.

uuid.description: The UUID of the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

container_name.description: The name of the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

custom_name.description: A custom name in addition to the container name to help you more easily identify the customer / container.

region.description: The Tenable.io AWS cloud region that contains the customer account. Customer account regions correspond to the regions used for [cloud sensors](https://docs.tenable.com/vulnerability-management/Content/Platform/Settings/Sensors/CloudSensors.htm). To avoid latency issues, Tenable recommends that scans in the customer instance use scanners in the same region as the customer account.

licensed_assets.description: The number of assets currently counted against the customer's Tenable.io license.

licensed_assets_limit.description: The number of assets which the customer is licensed to scan.

licensed_apps.description:
List of licensed Tenable applications. The applications can include:
  • pci—Tenable.io PCI/ASV
  • was—Tenable.io Web Application Scanning
  • consec—Tenable.io Container Security
  • lumin—Tenable Lumin

notes.description: User-defined text; for example, internal tracking or customer contact information.

logo_uuid.description: The UUID of the logo assigned to the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal. This attribute is only present if a custom logo is assigned to the account.

domains.description: A list of the customer domains.

created.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time on which the container was created; for example, `2021-01-16T12:00:00Z`.

modified.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time on which the container was last modified; for example, `2021-01-16T12:00:00Z`.

parent_uuid.description: The UUID of the parent account.

account_uuids.description: An array of child account UUIDs that you want to link with the parent account.

uuid.description: The UUID of the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

child_container_uuid.description: The UUID of the child container associated with the parent customer account.

user_name.description: The user name associated with the change.

old_value.description: The old value of the item that was changed.

new_value.description: The new value of the item that was changed.

created.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time on which the change was made; for example, `2021-01-16T12:00:00Z`.

status.description: The status of the domain. For example, `ACTIVE`, ACTIVATION_PENDING`, or `DISABLED`.

type.description: The type of domain. For example, `PRIMARY` or `SECONDARY`.

date_added.description: The Unix timestamp when the domain was added.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the child container in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

domains.description: An array of domains associated with the container.

message.description: A short status message about the operation.

filters.description: A list of filters available for the record type.

name.description: The field name to be used in request query strings when applying the filter.

operators.description: Strings which represent the comparison operations which can be used for the filter.

readable_regex.description: Provides a human-readable "hint" which describes what the filter string should look like.

type.description: The type of UI control which represents the filter.

regex.description: A regex which can be used by a user interface to validate input.

max_length.description: The max length of the filter.

group_name.description: Always set to `NULL`. Legacy attribute associated with deprecated functionality.

wildcard_fields.description: Array of strings which represent each field which supports "wildcard" search. Wildcard search is a mechanism where multiple fields of a record are filtered against one specific filter string. If any one of the supported fields' values matches against the filter string, then the record matches the wildcard filter. Note that for a record to be returned, it must pass the wildcard filter (if there is one) AND the set of standard filters.

notes.description: User-defined text; for example, internal tracking or customer contact information.

custom_name.description: A custom name in addition to the account name to help you more easily identify the customer / container.

logo_uuid.description: The UUID of the logo you want to assign to the customer account in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the container to add the new domain to.

domain_name.description: The domain you want to add to the container.

activation_code.description: The required activation code to add the domain to the specified container.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the container to add the new domain to.

domain_name.description: The domain you want to add to the container.

host_name.description: The host name associated with the domain name. Typically this is the first part of the email address of the user you want to send the verification to. For example, for user@example.com, `user` would be the host name.

is_resend.description: Indicates whether or not to resend the verification code.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the container that contains the logo.

name.description: The user-defined name of the logo.

logo_uuid.description: The UUID of a logo in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

account_uuids.description: An array of customer account UUIDs in the Tenable.io MSSP Portal.

error.description: A brief message about the missing or invalid parameter value(s).
A brief message about the object that could not be found.
A brief message about the conflict.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

message.description: A brief message about the cause of the error.
